meanings.definition: Theocentricities - the belief in a God-centered universe
meanings.sent1: Her theocentricities guided her every decision, always considering the divine in all things.
meanings.sent2: The community's theocentricities were evident in their daily prayers and rituals.
meanings.sent3: His theocentricities were so strong that he joked about consulting the heavens for weather forecasts.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work reflected theocentricities, with each painting a window into the spiritual realm.
meanings.sent5: Theocentricities colored her worldview, seeing everything through a lens of divine purpose.

meanings.definition: Theocentricities - actions or beliefs centered around a deity
meanings.sent1: Their theocentricities led them to build temples and offer sacrifices in honor of their gods.
meanings.sent2: In ancient civilizations, theocentricities shaped laws and customs to align with the will of the gods.
meanings.sent3: The town's theocentricities were so strong that even the market vendors offered prayers before opening shop.
meanings.sent4: Theocentricities intertwined with daily life, influencing everything from food choices to social interactions.
meanings.sent5: Theocentricities inspired great acts of charity and kindness towards fellow believers.

meanings.definition: Theocentricities - the state of being focused on divine matters
meanings.sent1: His theocentricities were evident in his constant contemplation of spiritual teachings.
meanings.sent2: The monastery fostered theocentricities among its monks, encouraging deep reflection on sacred texts.
meanings.sent3: Even in the midst of chaos, her theocentricities kept her calm and centered on higher truths.
meanings.sent4: The poet's verses were filled with theocentricities, exploring the mysteries of faith and existence.
meanings.sent5: Theocentricities brought a sense of peace and purpose to her life, anchoring her in times of uncertainty.
